questions.question: The coat was ………………… so I didn’t buy it.
If the water is ......................, we can go for a swim.
questions.description: Enough goes after the adjective or adverb it modifies.

questions.question: We didn’t manage to sell ………………….
questions.description: When enough modifies a noun, it goes before the noun.

questions.question: There were ...................... people at the party.
questions.description: Too cannot modify a noun however, it can go before words like many or much to indicate numbers or quantity.

questions.question: She is ..................... to handle this job.
questions.description: Enough goes after the adjective it modifies.

questions.question: She is ………………… to handle the situation.
questions.description: Use 'too' to talk about unwanted or undesirable extremes.

questions.question: She is …………………. to have a baby.
questions.description: Both ‘too old’ and ‘old enough’ are possible here with different meanings. She is too old to have a baby. (= She cannot have a baby now because she is too old.) / She is old enough to have a baby. (= She is of the right age to have a baby.)

questions.question: I quit because I had had ..................... their quarreling.
